intro: Psychotria convergens, commonly known as the California coffee plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal regions, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Psychotria convergens is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes other plants known for their ornamental and medicinal uses.
